page.title: 11THE CORNISH PASTY
page.content: In the olden days pasties were marked with the initial of its eater since the contents of the pasty varied and often still do today,to suit different tastes-vegetables,different meats, fruit or jam. The initial end was always eaten last so that if the pasty was not finished it could be reclaimed by its owner. The usual pasty however is filled with potatoes, turnip and meat and is a complete meal. This made it convenient to take into the fields or down the mine. Also made of barley flour the traditional pasty was heavy and hard-hard enough it is said to be dropped down a mine shaft without breaking.Nowadays pasty making is an important industry and shops and pubs sell mass-produced pasties in very large number.It is important to remember that the ingredients should be placed raw inside the pastry case.
